benchmark_details.name: PHYLOLM
benchmark_details.overview: PhyloLM is a method that adapts phylogenetic algorithms to Large Language Models (LLMs) to explore their relationships and predict performance characteristics in benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of PHYLOLM is to provide a tool that evaluates LLM development, relationships, and capabilities through a phylogenetic lens.

data.source: Benchmarks include outputs from diverse queries on a selection of LLMs, including both open-source and proprietary models.
data.annotation: Not applicable as the method relies on model outputs rather than annotated data.

methodology.calculation: Phylogenetic distance is computed based on the similarity of LLM outputs, and benchmark performance is predicted through logistic regression based on these distances.
methodology.interpretation: The results demonstrate that phylogenetic distance is significantly correlated with true performance scores across various benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Validated through comparison with ground truth relationships and performance metrics in benchmark tests.
